subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Julio Franco, the oldest player to hit a home run in the majors, has announced his retirement from baseball after a 23-year career in the major leagues and stints in his native Dominican Republic, Korea, Japan and Mexico. “It was the hardest decision in my life,” Franco said in an interview published Saturday by the Mexican sports daily Record.
